page.title: 09Farming In Petworth
page.content: There are 8 farms in the area, they range from 80 acres to 1,200 acres. They grow wheat,barley,oats,maize,peas and oil seed rape which is used to make margarine. They also grow potatoes and grass. They breed dairy cattle for milk and beef cattle for food,they also breed sheep for wool. The farms have many machines including tractors, combines, forage havesters and potato harvesters. They feed cattle grass in the summer. In winter they are fed hay and silage. Pigeons and rabbits are great problems. Many farmers shoot them. Farmers also spend a lot of time doing office work and some use computers.
